Name: Jar
Description: Buff-coloured pottery vessel with rounded base, small looped handles for suspension cords, wide mouth with pronounced rim, and purple-painted decoration comprising spirals with double zigzag lines. This form of pottery is typical of mid- to late fourth millennium BC richer burials in Upper Egypt. This vessel was excavated at the key early settlement near Kom el-Ahmar (the Hierakonpolis of later texts) in southern Upper Egypt.
